TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WritingProgressChangedEventArgs extends System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs

MemberSignature.Value: public WritingProgressChangedEventArgs (System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingProgressChangeLevel writingLevel, int number, int progressPercentage, object state);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingProgressChangeLevel writingLevel, int32 number, int32 progressPercentage, object state) cil managed
Public Sub New (writingLevel As WritingProgressChangeLevel, number As Integer, progressPercentage As Integer, state As Object)
public: WritingProgressChangedEventArgs(System::Windows::Documents::Serialization::WritingProgressChangeLevel writingLevel, int number, int progressPercentage, System::Object ^ state);

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: An enumeration value that specifies the scope of the progress changed event such as for an entire multiple document sequence, a single document, or a single page.
Based on the scope defined by , the number of documents or the number of pages that have been written.
The percentage of data that has been written.
The user-supplied object that identifies the write operation.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The user-supplied `state` parameter is the object passed to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter.WriteAsync%2A> method that identifies the asynchronous write operation.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Number As Integer
public: property int Number { int get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the number of documents or pages that have been written.
Docs.value: The number of documents or pages that have been written at the time of the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingProgressChangedEventArgs.WritingLevel%2A> property is <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingProgressChangeLevel.FixedDocumentSequenceWritingProgress>, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingProgressChangedEventArgs.Number%2A> specifies the number of documents that have been written. For all other <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingProgressChangedEventArgs.WritingLevel%2A> cases, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingProgressChangedEventArgs.Number%2A> is the number of pages that have been written.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property WritingLevel As WritingProgressChangeLevel

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates the scope of the writing progress.
Docs.value: An enumeration that indicates the scope of writing a multiple document sequence, a single document, or single page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingProgressChangedEventArgs.WritingLevel%2A> property is <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingProgressChangeLevel.FixedDocumentSequenceWritingProgress>, the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingProgressChangedEventArgs.Number%2A> property specifies the number of documents that have been written. For all other <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingProgressChangedEventArgs.WritingLevel%2A> cases, the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingProgressChangedEventArgs.Number%2A> property is the number of pages that have been written.
